89.author: edited by Robert G
89.appears_in: Weiner ; foreword by John Shelton Lawrence ; afterword by J.M. DeMatteis.
notes: "The topics discussed include the ways Nazi Germany was represented in Captain America Comics from the 1940s to the 1960s; the creation of Captain America in the Jewish American experience; the relationship between Captain America and Captain Britain; the partnership between Captain America and The Falcon; and various attempts to kill Captain America before his "real" death"

150.heading: Captain Catapult.
150.title: "Golly, We're Goin' Faster than a Streak of Thunder an' Lightnin'"
150.author: Ed Wheelan, art and letters
notes: Summary: Comics settles in to read some comics when his sister brings home her new beau, Corporal Tom Manley. In his dreams, Comics quickly recognizes him as Captain Catapult and, together, they capture all the mob bosses in town and take them to the police.
Data from Lou Mougin, Gary L. Watson and Peter Croome via Grand Comics Database.

notes: Summary: Baltazar gives Santiago a pendant, and months later Santiago's father says it's linked to an "ancient sun cult."

166.title: Captain Chicano
166.author: by David Torrez
notes: Santiago decides to return to the Chalco Valley and find out more about the pendant.

167.title: Captain Chicano

notes: Summary: Santiago is curious about Baltazar the sage's pendant, and learns more under the hypnotic power of an Eagle Stone.
